title: Frost-bitten dog found with rope around neck in Pontiac
text:

A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 1 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Frost-bitten dog found with rope around neck in Pontiac Detroit Free Press staff Published 10:39 a.m. ET Feb. 8, 2017 | Updated 28 minutes ago The dog will be put up for adoption after it recovers, authorities said Winston the dog was founded abandoned in Pontiac (Photo: Michigan Animal Rescue League) 
A emaciated dog with a 15-foot rope around its neck was found abandoned Tuesday near the Michigan Animal Rescue League facility in Pontiac. 
A volunteer at the facility was walking another dog when he noticed the male pit bull mix, which was barely able to stand and suffering from frost bite. 
“He’s been extremely uncomfortable and has untreated wounds as well as what appears to be frost bite on his hind legs,” said Magee Humes, the group's executive director. “Our guess is he has been terribly neglected for some time.” 
The dog, now called Winston, is at a veterinarian in Union Lake and is expected to recover.
